cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles south of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across Hispaniola and the Bahamas, then forecast to turn northwest to north-north-east along the Florida and southeast U.S. coastline toward the Carolinas.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Florida or the north-western Bahamas

weather_observation.watch_coast: Central Bahamas including Cat Island, the Exumas, Long Island, Rum Cay and San Salvador
weather_observation.warning_coast: Entire coast of Puerto Rico and Virgin Islands, southern & northern Dominican Republic coast, north coast of Haiti east of Le Mole St-Nicholas, Turks & Caicos, and south-eastern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Bahamas, Florida Peninsula, Georgia and Carolina coasts within the day-4/5 cone
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤7%) chance of tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds Monday–Tuesday; breezy conditions more likely than damaging winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge indicated for Wilmington at this stage.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring 1–3 inches of rain early next week.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip-current risk along SE North Carolina beaches early next week.
